title: [Large-Scale] ICE Collaborative Learning Workshop for Strengthening Academic Library Information Literacy: Supporting Social Science Research (History, Geography, Culture)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic library utilization experience and foundational knowledge of social science research topics (history, geography, cultural analysis, etc.)
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education for in-service professionals to enhance academic information search and utilization skills, emphasizing integration with social science research methodologies (history, geography, cultural analysis). Particularly strengthens connections with economic/political system analysis and civic rights-related research cases.

learning_goals: Learners can explain methodologies for efficiently searching academic library databases and electronic resources to collect information suitable for social science research topics (history, geography, cultural analysis, etc.).

Learners can apply techniques to evaluate and critically analyze academic information relevant to research topics, utilize credibility verification methods considering historical and cultural contexts, and apply a comprehensive evaluation framework incorporating political and economic variables.

Learners can apply the ICE Framework (Impact, Confidence, Ease of Implementation) to collaborate with peers, derive three information utilization strategies suitable for social science research (e.g., analysis of civil rights, institutional relationships), and present actionable strategies with an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale in team evaluation sheets.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
